story.title: How it all started with a handbuilt catamaran

easyLiving.title: Easy Living – a life's work
easyLiving.built: My father spent over 10 years building a 44-foot sailing catamaran.
easyLiving.builtDesc: With his own hands. Every plank, every sail, every screw. Anyone who does something like that knows what perseverance means.
easyLiving.charterIntro: Since 2016, he's been running charter trips –
easyLiving.charterLocations: Caribbean, Mediterranean, Baltic Sea trips from Travemünde
easyLiving.charterDesc: A one-man business, built with nothing but skill, passion, and a hell of a lot of work.
easyLiving.businessDesc: Regulars rave about it. Reviews are top-notch. Anyone who's sailed with him comes back.
easyLiving.butWebsite: But the website? It was from 2012.
easyLiving.noSeo: No responsive design. No online booking. No SEO. While new customers searched Google for 'catamaran charter Baltic Sea', they found the competition – not my father.

problem.title: The Problem
problem.text1: 'I'm a sailor, not an IT guy,' my father always said. And he was absolutely right.
problem.text1Bold: Why should someone who can build a catamaran by hand also know how to program React apps?
problem.text2: He simply had no time or desire to spend months dealing with code, SEO, GDPR, and payment systems. He wanted to sail and make his guests happy.

solution.title: The Solution
solution.text1Bold: So in 2024, we built it for him.
solution.text1: A completely new platform: Modern React website, real-time booking calendar, automated emails, 100% mobile-optimized, SEO-strong.
solution.text2: Everything he needed – without having to touch a single line of code himself.

realization.title: And then it hit us:
realization.text1Bold: a successful entrepreneur who built a damn catamaran with his own hands
realization.question: ...how many other entrepreneurs out there are facing the same problem?
realization.answer: Thousands? Tens of thousands? The entire German SMB sector?
